resource.chars:
the star discs coalesce 
as shown on the photograph 
and after one minutes 
exposure, they form an 
irregular mass with a 
longitudinal diameter of 
1170 micro-divisions which 
in two minutes increases 
to 1255 and in four minutes 
to 1485 micro-divisions.
The importance of the 
evidence here given when
applied to the determination 
of star magnitudes and 
variability from any chart 
which may be made by aid 
of photography is apparent,
and shows that this method 
will require careful discrimin-
ation
